timeline.author: saragluna

replies.bodyText: Because VirtualMachine.runCommands() cannot find the java environment when executing commands in the virtual machine.
replies.author: zhichengliu12581

replies.bodyText: And moving the command will help with the Java environment?
replies.author: saragluna

replies.bodyText: No, I just changed the way of executing commands from VirtualMachine.runCommands() to SSHShell.runCommands(). Command still needs to be executed.
replies.author: zhichengliu12581

replies.bodyText: Okay. Let's try fixing this Java environment issue then.
replies.author: saragluna

replies.bodyText: Sorry, after testing, if the virtual machine is created through test-resources.json, this problem does not occur, but if it is a virtual machine created by myself, there will be a problem of not being able to find the java environment. Maybe some configuration is missing in the virtual machine I created?
replies.author: zhichengliu12581

replies.bodyText: test-resources.json have a step to install java.
replies.author: chenrujun

timeline.message: Change the way of uploading files

timeline.bodyText: Please install java maven in this file: https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/spring/azure-spring-boot-test-keyvault/install_java.sh
timeline.author: chenrujun

timeline.message:
The virtual machine has installed the software

The corresponding software has been installed when the virtual machine is created

timeline.bodyText:
Can we use current branch instead of master branch?
Refs: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49106104/get-current-git-branch-inside-a-java-test
timeline.author: chenrujun

timeline.bodyText:
We need update origin too.
Refs: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/171550/find-out-which-remote-branch-a-local-branch-is-tracking
timeline.author: chenrujun

replies.bodyText: So why do we choose to pull the project from GitHub instead of pushing it?
replies.author: saragluna
